abstract: Federal prosecutors accused Novartis of paying illegal kickbacks to health care professionals through speaker programs, advisory boards, entertainment, travel and meals.
snippet: Federal prosecutors accused Novartis of paying illegal kickbacks to health care professionals through speaker programs, advisory boards, entertainment, travel and meals.
lead_paragraph: The Swiss drug giant Novartis is paying $422.5 million to settle criminal and civil investigations into the marketing of the antiseizure medicine Trileptal and five other drugs, federal officials said on Thursday.

headline.main: Novartis Settles Off-Label Marketing Case Over 6 Drugs for $422.5 Million
headline.print_headline: Novartis Settles Off-Label Marketing Case Over 6 Drugs for $422.5 Million
